Package de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.OpenRedirect.CWE601

Class OpenRedirectAttack

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.OpenRedirect.CWE601.OpenRedirectAttack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    public class OpenRedirectAttack
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This class contains the example of Open-Redirect attack, this example has been taken from the CWE-601. To avoid Open-Redirect, the best practice is to, not let the user provide the URL, even if they provide the URL, make sure to have a entry in the server that maps the URL to correct URL and then redirects otherwise do not redirect. In this example, we have consider redirectTable method as a sanitizer that maps the user input into valid URL, this techniques similar to Whitelist input validation.
    See Also:
    CWE-601, Serialized Form

      • OpenRedirectAttack

        public OpenRedirectAttack()

    • Method Detail

      • doGetWithoutSanitizer

        public void doGetWithoutSanitizer​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method redirects the page to requested URL. This does not use any sanitizer like redirectTable, therefore this contains Open-Redirect attack.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.

      • doGetWithSanitizer

        public void doGetWithSanitizer​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method redirects the page to requested URL. This uses sanitizer like redirectTable, therefore this avoids Open-Redirect attack.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.

      • redirectTable

        public java.lang.String redirectTable​(java.lang.String redirectLink)
        This is a simple redirect table that maps the user provided url or url-code to valid URL. Anything other than the values entered in the table will be considered as invalid input and redirection will not happen.
        Parameters:
        redirectLink - URL or URL-code provided by the user.
        Returns:
        Returns the valid URL otherwise null.
